metadata.Title: CVE-2017-7754 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
An out-of-bounds read in WebGL with a maliciously crafted "ImageInfo" object during WebGL operations. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 54, Firefox ESR < 52.2, and Thunderbird < 52.2.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-7754` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 54.0+build3-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
firefox-globalmenu - 54.0+build3-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 54.0+build3-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
firefox-testsuite - 54.0+build3-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

thunderbird - 1:52.2.1+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
thunderbird-globalmenu - 1:52.2.1+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:52.2.1+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:52.2.1+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
thunderbird-testsuite - 1:52.2.1+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:52.2.1+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:52.2.1+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:52.2.1+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro
